CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 17, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "Good Advertising?  According to A. & P. Food Stores' officials, this 'Mammy' ad was banned more than a month ago.  However, the display turned up again in the Walnut Street store.  The ad was reportedly removed as a result of citizens' protests.  A removal order was repeated this week, according to the chain stores advertising manager. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Interior of A&P grocery store with advertisement of derogatory image of African American woman saying "Lawsy Me! Dem A&P Fryin' Chickens Sho Am Tender," Walnut Street, Shadyside
